com.github.i49.hibiscus.formats

Class Formats

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.i49.hibiscus.formats.Formats

  • public final class Formats
extends Object
    A facade class to provide methods to create various kinds of formats implementing Format interface.

    All formats currently supported are shown in the table below.

    The list of formats
    No. Format Name Description Method to Create Implemented By
    1 datetime date and time format as defined in RFC 3339. datetime() DateTimeFormat
    2 email email address format as defined in RFC 822. email() EmailFormat
    3 hostname Internet domain name as defined by RFC 1034 and RFC 1123.
    This does not include IPv4 or IPv6 address.    		 hostname() HostnameFormat
    4 ipv4 Internet Protocol Version 4 address. ipv4() Inet4AddressFormat
    5 ipv6 Internet Protocol Version 6 address. ipv6() Inet6AddressFormat
    6 host Internet host which may be ipv4, ipv6, or hostname. host() HostFormat
    7 hostport Internet host optionally followed by a port number. hostport() HostFormat
    8 anyURI any URI including relative URI. anyURI() URIFormat
    9 absoluteURI absolute URI only. absoluteURI() AbsoluteURIFormat

    For example, the following code shows how to obtain datetime format by means of this class.

    
 import static com.github.i49.hibiscus.formats.Formats;
 datetime();
    See Also:
    Format

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static StringFormat absoluteURI()
      Returns the absouluteURI format which represents absolute URI.
      static StringFormat anyURI()
      Returns the anyURI format which represents URI including relative URI.
      static StringFormat datetime()
      Returns the datetime format which represents date and time as defined in RFC 3339.
      static StringFormat email()
      Returns the email format which represents email address as defined in RFC 822.
      static StringFormat host()
      Returns the host format which represents Internet host as defined by RFC 2396, amended by RFC 2732.
      static StringFormat hostname()
      Returns the hostname format which represents Internet host name as defined in RFC 1034 and RFC 1123.
      static StringFormat hostport()
      Returns the hostport format which represents Internet host followed by port number.
      static StringFormat ipv4()
      Returns the ipv4 format which represents Internet Protocol Version 4 address.
      static StringFormat ipv6()
      Returns the ipv6 format which represents Internet Protocol Version 6 address.
